It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, pale green to blue flowers that bloom during the cooler months, often in late winter or early spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Acosta subtilis is considered a vulnerable species.
